verses.verse: Remind them to submit to rulers and authorities, to obey them, to be ready for every good work,
not to insult anyone, or be contentious, [but to be] gentle, showing a complete meekness to all people.
We ourselves were also at one time foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various evil desires and pleasures, passing our time being spiteful, envious, obnoxious, and hating one another.
But as soon as the kindness and love of God our Savior toward mankind appeared,
he saved us, not by works of righteousness, which we have done, but according to his mercy, by the washing of regeneration and renewal by the Holy Spirit,
which he abundantly poured out on us through Jesus Christ our Savior,
that having been justified by means of his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
This is a trustworthy saying, and I want you to insist on them, so that those who believe in God might be conscientious to keep up good works. These things are good and beneficial to people.
Avoid foolish questions, genealogies, big arguments and battles over The Law, for they are not beneficial and useless.
Reject a heretic--after the first and second warning--
knowing that such a person is twisted and sins, being self-condemned.
When I send Artemas to you or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there.
Help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos in any way you can, so that they are lacking in nothing.
Also let ours learn to keep up good works for essential needs, so that they won't be unfruitful.
All that are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
